channel.title: Times of India
channel.description: The Times of India: Breaking news, views, reviews, cricket from across India

item.title: After six decades, a Chinese leader gets public welcome
item.description: There were many firsts on Wednesday when PM Modi received Chinese President Xi Jinping in Ahmedabad. It was the first time an Indian PM was receiving a foreign head of the state outside Delhi.

item.title: 100 more Chinese soldiers enter Ladakhâ€™s Chumar area
item.description: Chinese army on Wednesday refused to return even as a flag-meeting between the two sides is believed to have made no headway in breaking the deadlock.

item.title: On eve of Scottish independence referendum, British PM admits 'UK is nervous'
item.description: With the Scottish referendum too close to call, British PM David Cameron admitted he was concerned that the UK could be on the verge of breaking up.

item.title: Pune ATS lets key Indian Mujahideen man slip from its net
item.description: In one of the biggest blunders in police history, a terrorist was picked up by same cops twice, was shown his own sketch once and asked to identify the suspect. The terrorist denied any familiarity with the person in the sketch and walked away.

item.title: Widows from other states should not crowd Mathura: Hema Malini
item.description: "If they (widows) are not from here then there is no need for them to come here from other states. There are many famous temples in Bengal and Bihar too, where they can stay," Hema Malini said.
